column2: Introduction
The European Council adopted the European Security Strategy (ESS)
in December 2003. For the first time, it established principles and
set clear objectives for advancing the EU’s security interests based
on our core values. It is comprehensive in its approach and remains
fully relevant.
This report does not replace the ESS, but reinforces it. It gives an
opportunity to examine how we have fared in practice, and what
can be done to improve implementation.
